query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Assessment and revision of Road Maps based on demo assessment fellow airports
result.description: This report will reflect the road maps of airports participating in this consortium setting up the scene for an an integral structured road map as described in Task 103 Horizon for this will be the 2030 milestone This shall provide input to D106 and D107

result.title: Feasibility study: airports delivering energy supply for future aircraft. Appendices: Generic safety assessment and project plan for all demos
result.description: The report will include the implications for airport energy infrastructure and operations related to the implementation of hybridelectric and hydrogen aviation at hub national and regional airport including scheduling and cost The energyrelated findings are also used for WP3 The report will also describe barriers including mitigation for executing the demos A safety assessment of the three demonstration activities including validation of the assessment and identifiedLinked to task 21

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as Digital transition).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to Europes biodiversitys path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Simultaneous quantification of active, gravitational and DOC fluxes at range of contrasting sites
result.description: Simultaneous quantification of active gravitational and DOC fluxes at range of contrasting sites At multiple sites the three fluxes will be quantified simultaneously active flux using new acoustic observations of migrating organisms together with published sizebased relationships of carbon release gravitational flux using the prototype optical system deliverable 42 and physical samples eg from snowcatchers the DOC flux using water samples to quantify DOC concentrations together with estimates of turbulent mixing from historical data model output or opportunistic microstructure observations

result.title: First estimate of the role of mesopelagic fish in storing carbon in the ocean
result.description: NEMOPISCESAPECOSM will provide global estimates of the role of mesopelagic fish in carbon sequestration and atmospheric CO2 levels under two different climate scenarios for instance RCP 45 and 85 and two fishing scenarios for instance no fishing and 50 of the biomass taken

result.title: Report on Food-web structure from study regions from the ensemble of models
result.description: Documentation of the equations structure and parameterisation of each food web model together with baseline outputs on the abundances of food web components and biomass flows between them under contemporary environmental harvesting conditions at the locations to which they are applied

result.title: Appraisal of the capability for eDNA and egg/larval production to inform biomass estimates
result.description: The report will include an appraisal of the capability of environmental eDNA to inform about the taxonomic composition of mesopelagic microorganisms community focusing on fish as target group It will equally include an evaluation of the potential of the egg production method to estimate mesopelagic fish biomass It will indicate the information already available the research necessary and a pilot estimate using Maurolicus muelleri in the Bay of Biscay as model species
